Description: Stump of broom made from twigs; it is bound tightly 16mm from the end with many wraps (55mm long) of blue cotton thread 2 ply S (dia. 1mm) and a section of buff cotton thread 2 ply S (dia. 2mm); sweep end of the broom worn into a V shape, at handle end twigs have been cut to same length; there is a thicker piece of wood at the centre of the broom handle, surrounded by the thinner twigs, it does not extend to the sweep end of the broom; two other short, thicker pieces of wood are opposite eachother in the wrappings, possibly to give support
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), B25, room 96 NE section, below floor 2 B-125-H
